task_summary: The robot arm is tasked to pick the orange fruit from a tabletop among other objects. This involves detection, approach, grasp pose computation, gentle contact, grasp execution, and confirmation of the orange being secured in the gripper.

task_long_description.overview: In this episode, a blue robotic arm picks up an orange from a small table. The scene includes clearly visible fruit (apple, banana, orange), white cubes, and background shelving. The robot uses visual perception to locate the orange, approaches from above, computes the grasp pose, lowers until contact, and gently closes its gripper. Task progress is monitored stepwise, ending with verification that the orange is held securely. The episode prioritizes safe, direct motion and minimal disturbance to other items.
preconditions: The orange is positioned on the table and visible
Robot is ready with empty gripper
stepwise_plan: Verify orange visibility or reacquire via scan
Move above the orange with safe offset
Approach and align with tight tolerance
Close gripper with gentle force to grasp orange
success_criteria: Orange is grasped securely in gripper
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect orange: retry scanning
Grasp instability: abort and retry grasp sequence
task_long_description.termination: Tree ends when orange is confirmed held in gripper.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the orange is visible to the robot sensors.
Performs a grid scan to locate the orange if not immediately visible.
Detects precise pose and location of the orange.
Opens the gripper to an appropriate width in preparation for grasping.
Moves the gripper above the orange, offsetting vertically.
Computes grasp pose using top strategy, result stored keyed for orange.
Approaches and aligns with the orange with high precision.
Lowers gripper until gentle contact detected with orange.
Closes gripper with gentle force to grasp orange.
Checks if orange is securely held in gripper.

failure_modes: Orange is not detected during perception
Gripper fails to close or slips
recovery_strategy: Retry scanning and detection if orange not visible
Retry lower-and-grasp sequence if grasp fails
Abort and manual intervention if repeated failures occur
assumptions: Instruction and frames are consistent; orange present on table among other fruits
No explicit indication of transfer or placement after grasp (no 'place' in instruction or evidence in frames); episode ends at grasp.
Frame sequence supports standard tabletop fruit picking

expected_success_criteria: Orange is securely in the gripper at episode end
None of the surrounding objects are disturbed
